subject: Law
title: AI Liability and Business
description: A fast breakdown of AI Liability and Business for builders.

hook.text: An AI chatbot gives medical advice that harms a patient. Who's liableâ€”the developer, the company, or the AI itself?

buildup.text: AI liability is uncharted territory. Existing frameworks for product liability may apply, but gaps are emerging.

discovery.text: Product liability holds makers responsible for defective products. Courts may classify AI outputs as 'products.'

twist.text: AI decisions are often opaque. If nobody understands why an AI made a choice, proving fault becomes nearly impossible.

climax.text: The EU's AI Act creates risk tiers: high-risk AI in hiring and healthcare faces strict rules and audits.

punchline.text: AI creates value and risk. The law is figuring out who pays when it fails.

quiz.question: What legal framework might apply to harmful AI outputs?
